content:
Here is his obituary. Oddly (to me) it describes him as an attorney, not a developer, but it certainly seems to be him. https://www.legacy.com/obituaries/sfgate/obituary.aspx?n=michael-morris&pid=190894039&fhid=2782

I hope the work he created will not be lost, so I posted an inquiry on the Curesoft site's contact form to see if anyone responds. If not, the obituary lists numerous names to try.

(If he was primarily an attorney it underscores that his work didn't require being a career developer.)
Oh wow, so sad to see this (and only seeing this now), I thought we was doing better back in November! :sad:

All, FYI - last month I got this message from Mike's business partner Dan Fobes dan@curesoft.com:

Mike and I worked together deploying monitoring solutions for data centers then turned our focus to cancer patients which is how Curesoft came about.

I’m working with Mike’s family to continue the mission of Curesoft. We all believe this could be the foundation for healthcare and how cancer patients are treated. Mike and I started this about 3 years ago after he was diagnosed, and my dad had just passed with an almost identical diagnosis as Mike.

Hope to have updates soon.
